meanings.sent1: After drinking too much, he needed to soberize before driving home.
meanings.sent2: The counselor helped the person soberize after a night of partying.
meanings.sent3: Trying to walk in a straight line after spinning around quickly helped him soberize.
meanings.sent4: The rain soberized the mood of the outdoor party, causing everyone to go inside.
meanings.sent5: The strong coffee had the power to soberize him in minutes.

meanings.definition: To bring to a serious or calm state.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's stern look soberized the noisy classroom.
meanings.sent2: The calming music helped to soberize her anxious mind.
meanings.sent3: The silly joke did little to soberize the group of giggling friends.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news soberized the atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the sunset never failed to soberize her thoughts.
